title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Akash Deep likely to miss Sydney Test, deliberation over Rishabh Pant - The Indian Express
'Rohit Sharma, You Shattered India's Confidence': Captain Comes Under Scathing Attack After MCG Humiliation - NDTV Sports
summary:
'Rohit Sharma, You Shattered India's Confidence': Captain Comes Under Scathing Attack After MCG Humiliation

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Indian cricket team captain Rohit Sharma faced intense criticism following India's defeat to Australia in the fourth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, with former cricketer Basit Ali questioning Sharma's captaincy decisions.

  • Rohit Sharma's decision to open batting despite poor form was criticized, affecting the team's confidence.
  • Basit Ali highlighted the detrimental impact on KL Rahul after demoting him in favor of Sharma.
  • Criticism extended to Gautam Gambhir for his game management decisions.
  • Rohit and Virat Kohli were both dismissed cheaply, contributing to the team's struggles.
  • Ali suggested a captaincy change for the final Test, proposing Jasprit Bumrah take over leadership.
“One decision: 'I will open', that affected India. You (Rohit) completely shattered the confidence of the team,” said Basit Ali.

Ali's remarks underscore the dissatisfaction with Rohit Sharma's leadership and decision-making during a critical match, calling for immediate changes in captaincy and strategy.
newTitle: 'Rohit Sharma, You Shattered India's Confidence': Criticism Follows Australia's Victory Over India

summary:
BCCI Concerned Over Privilege Misuse by Support Staff Amid Team Struggles

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian cricket team is facing criticism as tensions rise within the squad during their tour in Australia, trailing in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series. BCCI officials are reportedly monitoring a support staff member for misusing privileges.

  • The Indian team is currently 1-2 down in the series against Australia.
  • Concerns have arisen over a support staff member's misuse of access privileges.
  • Head coach Gautam Gambhir's relationship with players is reportedly strained.
  • Rohit Sharma's leadership and communication on selection have come under scrutiny.
"If the performance doesn't improve, even Gautam Gambhir's position wouldn't be safe," a senior BCCI official stated.

The BCCI is concerned about team dynamics and performance as the team prepares for a crucial Test and the upcoming Champions Trophy.

title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: After unfairly omitting him for Melbourne, India need Shubman Gill in must-win 5th Test - The Indian Express
summary:
India's Dilemma: Shubman Gill's Role in Must-Win Sydney Test

Date & Source: January 1, 2025, Indian Express

Introduction: India faces a crucial decision in the must-win fifth Test against Australia in Sydney, with the future of young batsman Shubman Gill hanging in the balance.

  • Gill's form and role in the team have been a topic of discussion after a promising start to the tour.
  • Head coach Gautam Gambhir's preference for Cheteshwar Pujara and Gill's technical vulnerabilities have raised questions about his spot in the playing XI.
  • India's batting order has been shuffled, with Rohit Sharma opening and Gill finding himself in and out of the team.
  • The team management's decision to bench Gill for the Melbourne Test has further complicated his situation.

CASTLED! Mitch Starc gets some 'banana swing' to make a mess of Shubman Gill's stumps.

Conclusion: With the series on the line, India must decide whether to stick with Gill at No.3 or bring back Pujara, potentially strengthening their bowling attack at the cost of Gill's batting spot.
newTitle: India's Dilemma: Shubman Gill's Role in Must-Win Sydney Test

title: Rohit Sharma's Three Options In Do-Or-Die Sydney Test For India's Sake: Step Aside Or... - NDTV Sports
summary:
Rohit Sharma's Three Options In Do-Or-Die Sydney Test For India's Sake: Step Aside Or...

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

As India prepares for a must-win Test match against Australia, captain Rohit Sharma faces crucial decisions regarding team selection, especially concerning the inclusion of Shubman Gill.

  • India lost the Boxing Day Test by 184 runs, putting pressure on the team.
  • Shubman Gill, a top run-scorer, may return to the playing XI in place of a bowler.
  • Washington Sundar’s performance in the previous match complicates team balance.
  • Rohit has three options: include Gill by dropping a bowler, shift his position, or step aside himself.
  • Rohit’s own poor form raises questions about his role in the squad.
“Taking a back seat to allow the team to move forward is a call that can only be taken if the heart is in the right place.”

The outcome of the Sydney Test is critical for India's chances in the World Test Championship, making Sharma's decisions pivotal for the team's future.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Choices for Crucial Sydney Test Against Australia

title: Australian PM hilariously suggests legislation to stop Jasprit Bumrah's supremacy - The Times of India
summary:
Australian PM Proposes Legislation to Challenge Jasprit Bumrah's Dominance

Published on: October 2023, Source: Sports News Daily

This lighthearted suggestion from the Australian Prime Minister to create laws aimed at limiting Jasprit Bumrah's cricketing achievements has stirred both laughter and debate among cricket fans globally.

  • The Prime Minister humorously suggested that legislation could help Australian bowlers regain their competitive edge against Bumrah.
  • Cricket fans reacted on social media, expressing both amusement and disbelief at the PM's comments.
  • Former cricketers weighed in, discussing the implications of the PM's statement on the game.
“If only it were that easy to legislate skill on the cricket field!” - A cricket analyst

While the statement was meant to be humorous, it underscores the intense rivalry and admiration for Bumrah's unmatched talent in cricket.
newTitle: Australian PM Proposes Legislation to Challenge Jasprit Bumrah's Dominance

title: Harsha Bhogle reveals T20I Team of the Year 2024, excludes Kohli, Rohit, Suryakumar - CricTracker
summary:
Harsha Bhogle reveals T20I Team of the Year 2024, excludes Kohli, Rohit, Suryakumar

Publication Date: October 2023 • Source: Cricbuzz

Renowned commentator, Harsha Bhogle, recently unveiled his T20I side of the year for 2024, featuring a diverse selection of players but notably excluding cricket stalwarts Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

  • Bhogle's T20I team includes five Indian players, two West Indians, and one each from Australia, England, South Africa, and Afghanistan.
  • Key players selected include Travis Head and Phil Salt, both recognized for their aggressive batting styles.
  • Head scored 539 runs in 15 T20Is, while Salt contributed 467 runs in 17 T20Is.
  • Bhogle excluded Suryakumar Yadav, opting instead for Sanju Samson, Nicholas Pooran, and Heinrich Klaasen in the middle order.
  • The bowling lineup features Hardik Pandya, Andre Russell, Rashid Khan, Varun Chakravarthy, Arshdeep Singh, and Jasprit Bumrah.
“He had an astonishing white-ball season, is Travis Head. He's a left-hander, which makes such a lot of difference.” - Harsha Bhogle

In his selections, Bhogle provided insights into each player's performance, emphasizing their influence in T20 cricket this season.
newTitle: Harsha Bhogle reveals T20I Team of the Year 2024, excludes Kohli, Rohit, Suryakumar

summary:
Gautam Gambhir's Position Unsafe: India Head Coach's Wings To Be Clipped If Downward Spiral Continues

Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 21:16 IST

India’s latest defeat on their ongoing Australia tour has sparked tension between head coach Gautam Gambhir and some players, with media reports suggesting a lack of clear communication between the team management and the players since Gambhir’s arrival.

India have lost five of their last seven Tests and are now in a must-win situation in the fifth and final Test against Australia in Sydney. If the team’s performance doesn’t improve, Gambhir’s position could be reviewed, according to a senior BCCI official.

  1. Gambhir was not the BCCI's first choice for the head coach position.
  2. The BCCI is unhappy with a member of Gambhir's support staff who is accompanied by a personal assistant at all venues.
  3. India must win the Sydney Test to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and qualify for the World Test Championship final.

“There is a Test match to be played and then there is Champions Trophy. If the performance doesn’t improve, even Gautam Gambhir’s position wouldn’t be safe.” - A senior BCCI official

Source: PTI

title: Michael Clarke wants genius of Team India to bat at number 6 in fifth Test against Australia - Crictoday
summary:
Michael Clarke wants genius of Team India to bat at number 6 in fifth Test against Australia

Publication Date: Not available Source: Not available

Former Australia captain Michael Clarke has expressed his desire for Indian all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy to bat at number 6 in the upcoming fifth Test against Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

  • Clarke believes Reddy's performance warrants a higher batting position after scoring 294 runs in 7 innings.
  • Reddy impressed with an innings of 114 runs in the Boxing Day Test, showcasing his potential and skill.
  • Clarke described Reddy as a genius and highlighted his ability to handle pressure against Australian bowlers.
  • Former Indian head coach Ravi Shastri shares a similar sentiment regarding Reddy's batting order change.
  • India needs a win in Sydney to secure the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, prompting discussions on batting combinations.
“This young kid, who is batting at number eight, is a genius. I think he should bat at 6 or 7.” - Michael Clarke

The proposed change to Reddy's position could enhance Team India's strategy as they aim to retain their trophy against Australia.
newTitle: Michael Clarke advocates for Nitish Kumar Reddy to bat at number 6 in crucial Test match

title: SCG curator shares first update on pitch for fifth IND vs AUS Test: ‘Given a cut of about 7mm and a nice roll…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
SCG Curator Provides Update on Pitch for Fifth IND vs AUS Test

Date: Jan 01, 2025 06:03 PM IST Source: Hindustan Times

The SCG pitch curator has updated on the preparations for the upcoming Test match between India and Australia. With Australia currently leading the series, the pitch conditions are being finalized.

  • The pitch covers were removed on Wednesday.
  • A 7mm cut has been achieved for the grass.
  • Heavy rolling is scheduled to prepare the pitch further.
  • Curator Adam Lewis expresses satisfaction with the pitch's condition.
  • The match will be crucial for India's chances in the World Test Championship.
"So we're two days out now, getting to the final stages of the prep. We’ve taken the covers off this morning, given a cut of about 7mm and giving it a nice roll today." - Adam Lewis

This pitch preparation is crucial as Australia looks to maintain its lead in the series while India aims for a comeback.
newTitle: SCG Curator Provides Update on Pitch for Fifth IND vs AUS Test

summary:
Australian PM Hosts Indian Cricket Team Ahead of Sydney Test

Published on January 01, 2025, 22:51 IST

The Indian and Australian cricket teams attended a New Year’s reception hosted by Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and his fiancée, Jodie Haydon, at Kirribilli House. The event featured light-hearted moments and high praise for players, including Prime Minister Albanese reserving special admiration for India’s fast-bowling ace Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Albanese humorously suggested passing a law for Bumrah to bowl left-handed or off one step.
  • Sam Konstas, Australia’s new talent, met his childhood hero, Virat Kohli, and posed for a picture.
  • India’s head coach, Gautam Gambhir, shared his reflections on the tour, highlighting the challenges of playing in Australia.
  • Australian captain Pat Cummins expressed excitement for the decisive Sydney Test match.

With Australia leading the series 2-1, the upcoming Sydney Test promises an intense clash.

title: Jasprit Bumrah pips Ashwin to new India record in ICC rankings, goes past Shane Warne; Virat Kohli slips to 10-year low - Hindustan Times
summary:
Jasprit Bumrah Sets New India Record in ICC Rankings, Virat Kohli Slips to 10-Year Low

January 1, 2025 - Hindustan Times

India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah scripted history on Wednesday by going past Ravichandran Ashwin to become the highest-rated Indian bowler in ICC Test rankings. However, former India captain Virat Kohli slipped to a 10-year low in the rankings.

  • Bumrah's performance in the Melbourne Test earned him the highest rating (907) for an Indian bowler, surpassing Shane Warne's previous best.
  • Kohli's poor performance in the same test resulted in him dropping to his lowest ranking (24th) since 2014.
  • Rohit Sharma also dipped to a six-year low (40th) in the rankings.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal, however, reached a career-high rating (854) with his performance in the fourth Test.

While Bumrah's achievement is a significant milestone for Indian cricket, Kohli and Sharma's dip in rankings might cause concern for the team's management.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah Sets New India Record in ICC Rankings, Virat Kohli Slips to 10-Year Low

title: "Everyone Afraid Of Virat Kohli": Team India Told To Make Big Change In 5th Test At SCG - NDTV Sports
summary:
Everyone Afraid Of Virat Kohli: Team India Told To Make Big Change In 5th Test At SCG

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: NDTV

With just one Test left in the series against Australia, Team India may consider altering their lineup. Former cricketer Basit Ali suggests demoting Virat Kohli to No. 5 to improve his performance as he has struggled at the No. 4 spot.

  • India is trailing 1-2 in the series and this is their last chance to secure the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Basit Ali believes Kohli's current position is detrimental to his batting performance.
  • Ali calls for a strategic change and highlights that the team management seems hesitant to make changes due to fear of Kohli's reputation.
“If you are not able to score then drop lower down the order; Rohit is doing that but nobody thinking about Virat because everybody's afraid.” – Basit Ali

As they prepare for the 5th Test on January 3, Team India faces a critical moment to decide a strategic shift in player positions.
newTitle: Everyone Afraid Of Virat Kohli: Team India Told To Make Big Change In 5th Test At SCG

summary:
Vinod Kambli discharged from hospital, requests everyone to stay away from alcohol | WATCH

Date: January 1, 2025

Source: India TV News

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli was discharged from the hospital after being treated for various health issues. He emphasized the importance of abstaining from alcohol during his recovery.

  • Kambli was admitted to Akruti Hospital on December 21 due to health deterioration.
  • He walked out of the hospital wearing India's new ODI jersey and was welcomed by fans and supporters.
  • Kambli scored 1084 runs in Test cricket, averaging 54.20, with four centuries.
  • In ODI cricket, he made 2477 runs at an average of 32.59, including two centuries.
  • His first-class cricket record includes nearly 10,000 runs with an average of 59.67.
Kambli wished everyone a Happy New Year and appealed to fans to stay away from alcohol.

Kambli's appeal highlights his ongoing journey of recovery as he emphasizes the significance of health and wellness.

title: "Virat was getting frustrated with the lack of respect": Michael Clarke opines on Kohli-Sam Konstas controversy in fourth Test - Crictoday
summary:
Michael Clarke Defends Virat Kohli's Shoulder Incident with Sam Konstas

Published on December 26, 2024, by CricToday

Former Australia batter Michael Clarke has defended Virat Kohli's shoulder incident against 19-year-old Sam Konstas in the fourth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy 2024-25 in Melbourne. Clarke believes Kohli was frustrated with the lack of respect shown by Konstas towards Jasprit Bumrah. Kohli was fined 20 percent of his match fee and received one demerit point.

  1. Kohli collided with Konstas after the 10th over of Australia's innings on Day 1.
  2. Konstas scored 60 runs off 65 balls, targeting Bumrah with boundaries.
  3. India trails the series 1-2 after Australia's 184-run win in the Boxing Day Test.

“Virat Kohli is a tough cricketer. He will never take a backward step. I think Virat was frustrated with the lack of respect that Sam was showing towards the best bowler in the world, Jasprit Bumrah. I am sure he would have had a word with Sam after the match. He is not a nasty person.”

– Michael Clarke

Kohli's batting form has been a concern for India, who need to win the final Test to retain the trophy.
newTitle: Michael Clarke Defends Virat Kohli's Shoulder Incident with Sam Konstas

title: Naseem Shah Replaced, Saim Ayub Out? Pakistan's Strongest XI For 2nd Test vs SA - OneCricket
summary:
Pakistan's Potential Lineup for the 2nd Test Against South Africa

Publication Date: Not specifiedSource: Cricket One

After a narrow defeat in the first Test against South Africa, Pakistan is gearing up for a crucial second Test at Newlands, Cape Town. The article discusses potential changes to the team's lineup, focusing on players like Naseem Shah and Saim Ayub who may be at risk of being replaced.

  • Pakistan lost the first Test by two wickets despite solid bowling performances.
  • Saim Ayub struggled in the first Test, raising questions about his place in the lineup.
  • Naseem Shah may be replaced by Mir Hamza due to his inconsistent performance.
  • Pakistan's likely strongest XI includes Shan Masood, Saim Ayub, Babar Azam, and others.
“Saim showcased exemplary form in ODIs and T20Is, which is why we believe Pakistan will likely persist with him for the deciding clash in Cape Town.”

This upcoming match is critical for Pakistan to equalize the series after a disappointing start, prompting potential lineup changes to optimize their chances of success.
newTitle: Pakistan's Potential Lineup for the 2nd Test Against South Africa

title: Marcus Rashford speaks out on 'false stories' regarding Man Utd future - Metro.co.uk
Magnus Carlsen arrives one minute and 11 seconds late for 3-minute game, was buying new pair of jeans days after dispute - Hindustan Times
summary:
Magnus Carlsen Arrives Late for Blitz Game After Jeans Purchase

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Magnus Carlsen, the reigning World Blitz champion, made headlines again as he arrived late to his match while purchasing a new pair of jeans, shortly after a dispute over attire regulations.

  • Carlsen was disqualified from a previous event for failing to wear formal trousers.
  • The tournament organizers relaxed dress code regulations, allowing jeans under certain conditions.
  • In his return, he was late by one minute and 11 seconds for a three-minute game, yet still managed to win against German grandmaster Michael Bezold.
  • Carlsen expressed he was responsible for his tardiness due to shopping for new jeans.
  • Reports indicate that he defended his title at the championship alongside Ian Nepomniachtchi after drawing several matches.
“It feels good to be back,” Carlsen stated after his victory, confirming the purchase of new jeans.

This incident highlights ongoing discussions regarding chess tournament attire and player flexibility.
newTitle: Magnus Carlsen Arrives Late for Blitz Game After Jeans Purchase
